    • Constructor Detail

    • Method Detail

      • getIndexForChunk

        public DocumentBasedChunkIndex getIndexForChunk(ChronoChunk chunk)
        Returns the index for the given chunk.

        Please note that this is a potentially expensive operation in the case that the given chunk has no persistent index.

        IMPORTANT NOTE: Do not store the returned instance for extended periods of time, e.g. in fields. Re-fetch it as needed, the instances are cached. The reason is that the indices may be deleted via deleteIndexForChunk(ChronoChunk).

        Parameters:
        chunk - The chunk to get the index for. Must not be null.
        Returns:
        The index for the chunk. Never null.

      • getIndexForChunkAsFuture

        public java.util.concurrent.Future<DocumentBasedChunkIndex> getIndexForChunkAsFuture(ChronoChunk chunk)
        Returns the index for the given chunk, as a Future.

        Please note that this is a potentially expensive operation in the case that the given chunk has no persistent index.

        IMPORTANT NOTE: Do not store the returned instance for extended periods of time, e.g. in fields. Re-fetch it as needed, the instances are cached. The reason is that the indices may be deleted via deleteIndexForChunk(ChronoChunk).

        Parameters:
        chunk - The chunk to get the index for. Must not be null.
        Returns:
        A future representing the index for the given chunk. Never null.

      • deleteIndexForChunk

        public void deleteIndexForChunk(ChronoChunk chunk)
        Deletes all indices (both in-memory representation and files) for the given chunk.

        Calling this method inevitably entails that the next call to getIndexForChunk(ChronoChunk) (with the given chunk as argument) will have to re-create that index from scratch, which is an expensive operation. Use this method with care!

        If the given chunk has no index, this method does nothing.

        Parameters:
        chunk - The chunk to delete the index for. Must not be null.

      • deleteAllChunkIndices

        public void deleteAllChunkIndices()
        Deletes all chunk indices (both in-memory representation and files).

        Calling this method inevitably entails that the next call to getIndexForChunk(ChronoChunk) will have to re-create that index from scratch, which is an expensive operation. Use this method with care!

        If no indices exist, this method does nothing.

      • rollbackChunkIndices

        public void rollbackChunkIndices(java.util.Set<java.lang.String> branchNames,
                                 long timestamp)
        Rolls back the contents of chunk indices.
        Parameters:
        branchNames - The branches to roll back. Must not be null. If this is set is empty, this method returns immediately without performing any operations.
        timestamp - The timestamp to roll back to. Must not be negative. Must be within the validity period of the last chunk.

      • rollbackChunkIndices

        public void rollbackChunkIndices(java.util.Set<java.lang.String> branches,
                                 long timestamp,
                                 java.util.Set<QualifiedKey> keys)
        Rolls back the contents of chunk indices.

        This is possible only for indices of chunks that are open-ended, i.e. the last chunk in each branch. This method has no effect on intermediate chunks.

        Parameters:
        branches - The branches to consider for rollback. Must not be null. If this is set is empty, this method returns immediately without performing any operations.
        timestamp - The timestamp to roll back to. Must not be negative. Must be within the validity period of the last chunk.
        keys - The set of keys to roll back. If this is the empty set, no key will be rolled back and this method returns immediately. If this is null, then all keys will be rolled back.

      • deleteIndexContents

        public void deleteIndexContents(java.lang.String indexName)
        Deletes the contents of the given index, for all branches.

        For indices that are being held in memory, this means that the index with the given name will be deleted. For persistent indices, this will result in the deletion of the entire index (file), which will entail a full re-index on the next request.

        Parameters:
        indexName - The index to delete. Must not be null.
